page.title: 08Ryde Pier
page.content: In{1812}a company was formed called the{Ryde Pier Company}and a bill passed in Parliament to make this law The first pier was wooden{1,740 feet {long}with a toll house at the shore end.This meant that boats could tie up and unload their passengers without getting their feet wet.In{1824,1827 {and 1833}the pier was extended,in{1846 the pierhead was enlarged to take more boats.In the{1870's}a new pier was built alongside the old pier,so{Ryde} had two piers for a while.In the{ {1860's}the first{horsedrawn trams} arrived to take people from the boats to the shore.The first{train arrived {in 1876}when a track was laid alongside the tramway.{Ryde pier}is a half a mile long which is the{second {longest in the country. }
